episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of intriguing topics, including the macabre use of soldiers' bones from the Battle of Waterloo in sugar production, the unique digestive system of puffer fish, the laborious process of recording music in the 1890s, and the US government's database of dad jokes.

facts.fact: Thousands of soldiers who died at Waterloo were turned into sugar.
Puffer fish don't have a functioning stomach, so they digest food in their rectum.
As there used to be no way of duplicating a record, one of the best selling songs of the 1890s had to be recorded over 10,000 times by the same singer.
The US government maintains a database of dad jokes.
